title: Malcolm ‘Molly’ Duncan, tenor saxophonist and co-founder of the Scottish funk group the Average White Band – obituary
text:
Malcolm ‘Molly’ Duncan,who has died aged 74, was a tenor saxophonist who co-founded the Average White Band, the funk outfit who scored a huge and enduring hit in 1974 with Pick up the Pieces.

Largely instrumental, apart from the band shouting out the title at several junctures, it became a US No 1 and a first port of call whenever a jazzy soundtrack was required or a rapper was looking for a funky sample.

“It’s about picking yourself up when things aren’t going well,” Duncan said of the song. “We had spent a lot of time making no money whatsoever, so it felt very relevant.”

Malcolm Duncan was born at Montrose, Scotland on August 24 1945. He attended Duncan of Jordanstone College of Art in Dundee,...
description: Malcolm ‘Molly’ Duncan,who has died aged 74, was a tenor saxophonist who co-founded the Average White Band, the funk outfit who scored a huge and enduring hit in 1974 with Pick up the Pieces.
